TITLE: Inflation figure that the Fed follows closely hits highest level since January 1982
SUMMARY: An inflation gauge that the Federal Reserve uses as its primary barometer jumped to its highest 12-month gain in more than 40 years in June.

TITLE: Euro zone economy grows 0.7% in the second quarter despite gas crisis and inflation surge
SUMMARY: Growth in the euro zone beat expectations for the second quarter, coming in at 0.7%.

TITLE: Yellen says the economy is not in a recession despite GDP slump
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Thursday the U.S. economy is in a state of transition, not recession, despite two consecutive quarters of negative growth.

TITLE: There is deflation in some items as Wingstop notes dropping chicken wing prices
SUMMARY: At a time when many consumers may have forgotten what deflation is, Wingstop said it's reaping the benefits of lower chicken wing prices.

TITLE: Watch Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen talk live about the state of the U.S. economy
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen speaks at a news conference on Thursday afternoon, following the release of second-quarter GDP data.

TITLE: The economy may look like it's in recession, but we still don't know for sure
SUMMARY: The GDP report brought the economy in line with a common definition of recession. But we won't know for sure if it officially becomes one at least for months.

TITLE: GDP fell 0.9% in the second quarter, the second straight decline and a strong recession signal
SUMMARY: Gross domestic product fell 0.9% at an annualized pace for the period, according to the advance estimate.

TITLE: The economy is expected to have barely grown last quarter and it may have contracted
SUMMARY: Economists are forecasting the economy barely grew in the second quarter, and some expect that it actually contracted.

TITLE: Fed hikes interest rates by 0.75 percentage point for second consecutive time to fight inflation
SUMMARY: The Federal Open Market Committee released its post-meeting statement Wednesday on what it will be doing with interest rates.

TITLE: Pending home sales fell 20% in June versus a year earlier as mortgage rates soared
SUMMARY: The decline in sales coincided with mortgage rates soaring to over 6% last month.

TITLE: Mortgage demand declines further, even as interest rates drop a bit
SUMMARY: Mortgage demand continues to drop, even though interest rates have come down slightly from recent highs.

TITLE: Homebuilders are boosting incentives as they suddenly struggle to sell homes
SUMMARY: The nation's homebuilders are now experiencing a slowdown in sales and an increase in supply.

TITLE: Here's how to know if we're in a recession, and it's not what you think
SUMMARY: Officially, the NBER defines recession as "a significant decline in economic activity that is spread across the economy and lasts more than a few months."

TITLE: Home price growth slowed for the second straight month in May, S&P Case-Shiller says
SUMMARY: Home prices in May were 19.7% higher compared with the same month last year, according to the S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller National Home Price Index.

TITLE: The numbers show the U.S. economy is at least teetering on a recession
SUMMARY: With second-quarter GDP data due out Thursday, the question of whether the economy is in recession will be on everyone's mind.

TITLE: CEOs say they are raising prices, cutting costs as inflation dominates post-earnings conversations
SUMMARY: Most company leaders say they've managed to navigate difficult times spurred by inflationary pressures at their highest level in more than 40 years.

TITLE: West Coast ports reduce idling vessels as container supply increases
SUMMARY: There are signs of shipping disruptions easing but movements in demand and inflation will continue to threaten supply chains.

TITLE: Jobless claims rise again in another sign that labor market is cooling
SUMMARY: Initial claims for unemployment insurance were expected to total 240,000 for the week ended July 16, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: June home sales fall 5.4% from May, as prices set yet another record
SUMMARY: The median price of an existing home sold in June set yet another record at $416,000, an increase of 13.4% year over year.

TITLE: Mortgage demand drops to a 22-year low as higher interest rates and inflation crush homebuyers
SUMMARY: The pain in the mortgage market is only getting worse amid higher interest rates and inflation in the overall economy.

TITLE: Yellen says the U.S. and its allies should use ‘friend-shoring’ to give supply chains a boost
SUMMARY: The term draws on the concepts of "onshoring" and "nearshoring," which refer to the transferring of supply chains back home or closer to home.

TITLE: China holdings of U.S. debt fall below $1 trillion for the first time since 2010
SUMMARY: China's holdings of U.S. debt have fallen below $1 trillion for the first time in 12 years. Rising rates have made Treasurys potentially less attractive.

TITLE: Retail sales rose more than expected in June as consumers remain resilient despite inflation
SUMMARY: Advance retail sales were expected to increase 0.9% in June, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Wholesale prices shoot up near-record 11.3% in June on surge in energy costs
SUMMARY: The producer price index, a measure of the prices received at the wholesale level, increased 11.3% from a year ago.

TITLE: Fed report finds higher fears of inflation and potential recession
SUMMARY: A Fed survey pointed to elevated recession fears along with a belief that soaring inflation will last at least through the end of the year.

TITLE: Inflation rose 9.1% in June, even more than expected, as consumer pressures intensify
SUMMARY: The consumer price index, soared 9.1% from a year ago, above the 8.8% Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: Near-term inflation expectations hit record high, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Consumers' inflation expectations over the next year hit record highs, though the outlook over the longer term grew a little more optimistic.

TITLE: U.S. recession looks likely — and there are 3 ways the economy could get hit, analyst says
SUMMARY: The odds of the U.S. economy falling into recession by next year are greater than 50%, TD Securities said Monday, outlining three possible ways it could get hit.

TITLE: Big payroll gains push recession fears into the corner — for now
SUMMARY: June's big payroll jump helped clear away some of those recession clouds for a U.S. economy that nonetheless faces some stormy weather ahead.

TITLE: Unemployment rate for Black women fell in June, but so did their participation in the labor force
SUMMARY: The U.S. unemployment rate fell for Black women last month, but labor force participation also slipped for the group.
